definition: to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]

sentences.english: The inhabitants are suffering for provisions.
sentences.chinese: 居民们正苦于缺乏粮食。

sentences.english: And all those companies are plagued by backed-up orders and delivery delays.
sentences.chinese: 而所有这些公司都苦于订单堆积及交货延误。

sentences.english: The school labours under the disadvantage of not having enough textbooks .
sentences.chinese: 这所学校苦于课本不足的不利条件。

sentences.english: However, no eye in the sky opened suffering, the spirit world unknown.
sentences.chinese: 然而，苦于没有天目，不能了解灵界。

sentences.english: But government departments are struggling to implement the measures.
sentences.chinese: 然而政府部门正苦于实施这些措施。

sentences.english: We’ve all agonized over difficult decisions. Go to college or backpack around Europe?
sentences.chinese: 我们都苦于决择，去上大学还是背包徒步到欧洲旅行？

sentences.english: But the plan is plagued by bureaucratic in-fighting.
sentences.chinese: 只是这计划又苦于官僚之间的混战难以实施。

sentences.english: There are not enough women in positions of power. The world has suffered from this deficit for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 整个世界很长时间都一直苦于当要权的女性过少。

sentences.english: The caller is having a tough time right now making ends meet.
sentences.chinese: 这位打电话的人现在正苦于让收支相抵。

sentences.english: Yu Mr. Suffer from mountain road in the north, went out to block making way.
sentences.chinese: 愚公苦于山北面道路阻塞，出去进来都要绕远路。

sentences.english: But all also suffer from cystic in Xiuse, often embarrassing for the poor worry about.
sentences.chinese: 但这一切又苦于囊中羞涩，时常为此尴尬穷愁。

definition: to do something to sb/to deal with/to cope/how?/to no avail
to be embarrassingly short of money
the will is there, but not the strength (idiom)/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
pinyin: xin1 you3 yu2 er2 li4 bu4 zu2

definition: to have a mind to/to intend to/deliberately/considerate
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
to settle for second best/the next best thing
to be unable to find a solution/to be at wits' end
to have no alternative but to/to be obliged to
it is a pity/what a pity/unfortunately
